action.action-desc: Mr. Van Orden introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to limit the amount of time the Secretary of Veterans Affairs may extend the period of a vocational rehabilitation program for a veteran.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the VR&E Accountability Act.

section.header: Limitation on extension of a vocational rehabilitation program for a veteran
section.text: Section 3105(c) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking The Secretary and inserting (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary;
by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The Secretary may not, under this subsection, extend the period of a vocational rehabilitation program for a veteran so that such period exceeds ninety-six months until after the Secretary—

subparagraph.text: determines that extraordinary circumstances apply in the case of such veteran; and
submits to the Committees on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate and House of Representatives written notice of such extension and the extraordinary circumstances for such extension.
